Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk baobab
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gnome utilities bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: GNOME 3 is the default desktop environment in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. GNOME utilities is a summary term for GNOME utility applications, for example text editor and calculator. This update contains a number of rebases to the latest upstream stable versions, which provide a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous versions. For more information on the upstream changes, see the GNOME release notes in the References section and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 Release Notes: The vala packages have been upgraded to version 0.26.1. (BZ#1174432) The folks packages have been upgraded to version 0.10.0. (BZ#1174528) The tracker packages have been upgraded to version 1.2.6. (BZ#1174534) The baobab packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.1. (BZ#1174557) The gnome-dictionary packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.2. (BZ#1174558) The gnome-screenshot packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.0. (BZ#1174559) The gnome-system-log packages have been upgraded to version 3.9.90. (BZ#1174561) The gnome-system-monitor packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.1. (BZ#1174566) The inagre packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.3. (BZ#1174568) The vino packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.2. (BZ#1174570) The gnome-font-viewer packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.0. (BZ#1174572) The gnome-calculator packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.1. (BZ#1174575) The brasero packages have been upgraded to version 3.12.1. (BZ#1174577) The file-roller packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.2. (BZ#1174580) The eog packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.2. (BZ#1174581) The cheese packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.2. (BZ#1174584) The gnome-tweak-tool packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.2. (BZ#1174585) The gucharmap packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.2. (BZ#1174590) The gedit packages have been upgraded to version 3.14.1. (BZ#1174591) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, the file-roller archive manager terminated unexpectedly with a segmentation fault after a compressed file was extracted using command-line arguments. The underlying source code has been fixed, and file-roller now confirms by displaying the "extraction completed" dialog, and no longer crashes in the described scenario. (BZ#1186481) When extracting a large tarball archive, the tracker-miner-fs process previously terminated unexpectedly, displaying this information on the desktop screen. This bug has been fixed, and such error messages are no longer displayed. (BZ#1194239) On systems with several CPUs, a CPU core sometimes became completely idle. Consequently, gnome-system-monitor stopped counting the number of CPUs when it encountered one with zero load, and thus reported an incorrect number of CPUs. A patch has been applied to query the number of CPUs from the system directly, and the correct number of CPUs is now detected, regardless of CPU load on a particular CPU. (BZ#1254332) Users of gnome utilities are advised to upgrade to all the rebased GNOME packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
